description: Length of Roman notation for n < length of decimal representation.
links: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..55 (complete up to 3999)
example: 1000 = M is shorter in Roman numerals, so 1000 is in this sequence.
maple: for n from 1 to 3999 do if(length(convert(n,roman)) < length(n))then printf("%d, ",n): fi: od: # Nathaniel Johnston, May 18 2011
prog: (Haskell)a036786 n = a036786_list !! (n-1)a036786_list = [x | x <- [1..], a006968 x < a055642 x]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 20 2013
author: _J. H. Conway_
